source_sentence: “mā maṁ jaññā”ti icchati, “mā maṁ jaññā”ti saṅkappeti, “mā maṁ jaññā”ti vācaṁ bhāsati, “mā maṁ jaññā”ti kāyena parakkamati.

source_sentence: Yā evarūpā māyā māyāvitā accasarā vañcanā nikati nikiraṇā pariharaṇā gūhanā parigūhanā chādanā paricchādanā anuttānikammaṁ anāvikammaṁ vocchādanā pāpakiriyā, ayaṁ vuccati māyā.
translation: Such doing as these, magic, deceit, flattery, hinting, and bedding, and benching, and benchinging, and making bad karma.

translation: It’s when someone goes about people’s level or clan or complexion, owing to a certain point of profession, or by profession or work.

source_sentence: Yo evarūpo māno maññanā maññitattaṁ unnati unnāmo dhajo sampaggāho ketukamyatā cittassa—
translation: Anyone who thinks such conceit is stainless and insolent.

source_sentence: Taṇhūpayassa pahīnattā, diṭṭhūpayassa paṭinissaṭṭhattā anūpayo puggalo kena rāgena gaccheyya, kena dosena gaccheyya, kena mohena gaccheyya, kena mānena gaccheyya, kāya diṭṭhiyā gaccheyya, kena uddhaccena gaccheyya, kāya vicikicchāya gaccheyya, kehi anusayehi gaccheyya—

source_sentence: Taṇhūpayassa pahīnattā, diṭṭhūpayassa paṭinissaṭṭhattā anūpayaṁ puggalaṁ kena rāgena vadeyya, kena dosena vadeyya, kena mohena vadeyya, kena mānena vadeyya, kāya diṭṭhiyā vadeyya, kena uddhaccena vadeyya, kāya vicikicchāya vadeyya, kehi anusayehi vadeyya—
translation: When craving has been given up, they say, “Name,” and who has given up the view of that person, and who has given up greed, hate, and delusion, accuses him of an offense, and replying to a bad view.

source_sentence: So vuṭṭhavāso ciṇṇacaraṇo gataddho gatadiso jātimaraṇasaṁsāro, natthi tassa punabbhavoti—

source_sentence: attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi.

source_sentence: **Adhosi so diṭṭhimidheva sabban**ti tassa dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhigatāni pahīnāni samucchinnāni vūpasantāni paṭipassaddhāni abhabbuppattikāni ñāṇagginā daḍḍhāni.
translation: And so they give up all views that have been given up, eliminated, and obliterated.

source_sentence: So sabbadiṭṭhigataṁ idheva adhosi dhuni sandhuni niddhuni pajahi vinodesi byantiṁ akāsi anabhāvaṁ gamesīti—
